item.title: Monopoly GO: Pinata Smash Rewards And Milestones
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Pinata Smash Monopoly GO Rewards And Milestones
  • Pinata Smash Monopoly GO Leaderboard Rewards
  • How To Get Points In Pinata Smash Monopoly GO

The Crop Course tournament has just ended, and Monopoly GO has now replaced it with a new leaderboard tournament: Pinata Smash. It kicked off on Nov 30 and will continue for only one day.

The Pinata Smash tournament comes with many useful rewards, such as dice, Peg-E Prize Drop tokens, and stickers. In this article, you will find everything you need to know about the Pinata Smash Monopoly GO tournament.

How To Get Points In Pinata Smash Monopoly GO

The Pinata Smash leaderboard event asks gamers to land their tokens on the Railroad spaces. By beating the tournament, you will earn a total of 10,890 dice and 477 Peg-E Prize Drop tokens.

Here are the points you will receive through Shutdowns and Bank Heists:

Shutdown

  • Blocked: Two Points
  • Successful: Four Points.

Bank Heist

  • Small: Four Points
  • Large: Six Points
  • Bankrupt: Eight Points.

item.title: Enshrouded: Every Pet In The Game
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Enshrouded is a survival game where players can tame various pets for companionship.
  • Dogs and cats are among the pets that can be rescued and tamed in different locations.
  • Other animals like Flightless Redtail, Goats, Fae Deer, Hophare, and Yaks are also tameable in the game.

The survival action-adventure game Enshrouded recently received a brand new DLC to accompany its base game. Named 'Souls of the Frozen Frontier,' the expansion introduced a plethora of new elements, such as unexplored lands for players to investigate, crafting options, open world class systems, and original quests, alongside a slew of other new additions to gameplay.

As part of this DLC, the developers Keen Games also added pets and animals to the game, ranging from dogs to cattle, while allowing players to tame these wild creatures for companionship as they explore the lands of Embervale and try to survive within its vast open world.

1 Cats and Dogs

Purrfect Pets

Hearts to Tame

Region

Produce

Three

Varies

NA

Man's best friend - the dog can be actively tamed in Enshrouded. Dogs can be rescued from the harsh world of Embervale and taken to your base. Three different dogs can be rescued, located in various areas across the open world. The first is Ruffles. Ruffles is a labrador-looking dog with a yellow-beige color and excessive energy. Ruffles can be found in the village of Thornhold, locked up in a cage by scavengers. Players also have the chance to rescue Ikko, a deserted pup found in the Abandoned Watchtower. The dark-colored pooch has been seemingly left to his own devices, wandering the tower aimlessly until picked up by the player.

The final dog players can find is Pompom Jr in the village of Shorewatch, in one of the area's dungeons. As with all the tameable animals in Enshrouded , Pompom Jr can be tamed using bait and petting to settle the creature before returning it to base.

As with dogs, cats can also be tamed. Much like dogs, players can tame three cats in Enshrouded. The striped cat Tyger, known for its hunting prowess, can be found in the village of Lone Thistle, overridden by the evil Fell. The cat Sapphire, named after its namesake village, the Sapphire Strand, can be located in the hamlet, patrolled by scavengers. The final cat obtainable is the aptly named Captain Whiskers, found in another scavenger settlement known as the Scavenger Ruins. This black cat constantly demands attention, purring adorably when the player is near.

2 Flightless Redtail

Stunning, Exotic Pet

Hearts to Tame

Region

Produce

Three

Nomad Highlands

Eggs

Alongside household pets, Flameborn can also tame (as pets) a range of farm animals to produce goods such as eggs. One of these is the Flightless Redtail. A red and orange-colored bird that cannot fly, the Redtail can be found in the Nomad Highlands and can be tamed using Flightless Redtail Food Bait. Once tamed, these majestic creatures can be taken back to base and produce eggs for consumption.

3 Goat

A Staple for Thriving Settlements

Hearts to Tame

Region

Produce

One

Springlands

Milk

Goats are essential in the production of milk in Enshrouded. Located in the Springlands, Goats are fairly timid in the lands of Embervale, running away from suspected players upon approach - making them hard to tame. Alongside their produce, goats can be harvested for fur, meat, and bones, all used in crafting. Goats are one of the main creatures players can tame in Enshrouded .

4 Frizzy Goat

Valuable for Advanced Crafting

Hearts to Tame

Region

Produce

Three

Albaneve Summits

Frizzy Goat Milk

A variation of the normal goat, Frizzy Goats are notably harder to tame than their counterparts. Frizzy Goats also flee the player upon sight, producing Frizzy Goat milk instead of basic milk used in crafting. These creatures are found in an entirely different area than the common variety, known as the Albaneve Summits, which are frosty mountains that host unimaginable darkness at their peak.

5 Hophare

Adorable Companion

Hearts to Tame

Region

Produce

Three

Springlands

N/A

While not useful in their produce, Hophare are bunny-like creatures found in the Springlands. These tiny furry creatures do not produce anything of value aside from the raw meat and fur they drop upon death. Nevertheless, they make cute pets, becoming a cuddly staple of a player's base when tamed.

6 Fae Deer

Enchanting Fairy-Like Aesthetic

Hearts to Tame

Region

Produce

Three

Revelwood

Fae Deer Milk

The adorably cute Fae Deer can be tamed using Fae Deer Food Bait, living in the forestry base of Revelwood. The creature produces Fae Deer milk that can be consumed once cooked and resembles a deer crossed with a fairy. Much like the other tameable creatures on this list, the Fae Deer enjoys all the attention it can get from the player, playing into its adorableness.

7 Yak

Sought-After Cattle

Hearts to Tame

Region

Produce

Three

Albaneve Summits

Wool

The final tameable pet on this list is the Yak. Like its real-life counterpart, Yaks in Enshrouded are giant hairy cattle with large horns protruding from their heads. These creatures, once tamed, can be used to produce raw wool, which can be used in crafting. Sought after creatures in the realm of Embervale, Yak is found on Albaneve Summits, much like the Frizzy goats, prized for their wool and dense pelts to protect against wintery conditions.

item.title: Roblox: Anime Reborn Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Anime Reborn Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Anime Reborn
  • How to Get More Anime Reborn Codes

Anime tower defense games have become extremely popular on Roblox as of late, as evidenced by the success of Anime Reborn . Released in late 2024, the game quickly rose to the top of the best experiences list, with hundreds of thousands of people taking the time to check it out.

The game provides Roblox players with numerous rewards just for playing, although those looking to get their hands on some extra Gems can do so by using Anime Reborn codes. This guide contains all of the latest codes for Anime Reborn , as well as information on how players can redeem them.

Updated December 1, 2024, by Tom Bowen: The last few updates have introduced a ton of content, including new units, mounts, and raids. Sadly, however, they also introduced a couple of game-breaking bugs that required downtime and server restarts. As a way of apologizing for this, the devs have added a few new Anime Reborn codes, which players can redeem to get more free Gems and Rerolls. After doing so, they should take a moment to bookmark this page and then check back here often, as we're constantly adding new codes for Anime Reborn to the list down below.

All Anime Reborn Codes

All Working Anime Reborn Codes

  • !SorryForBug - Redeem code for 2,000 Gems, 5 Trait Rerolls, and 25 Mage Stones (NEW)
  • SorryForRestart - Redeem code for 2,500 Gems and 3 Lucky Potions (NEW)
  • !BlackFriday - Redeem code for 5,000 Red Tickets, 5 Rerolls, and 500 Gems (NEW)
  • !Dungeon - Redeem code for 5 Rerolls and 500 Gems (NEW)
  • SorryForDelay - Redeem code for 5 Rerolls (NEW)
  • Happythanksgiving - Redeem code for 10,000 Red Tickets, 10 Trait Crystals, and 1,000 Gems
  • Happybirthdaysage - Redeem code for 5 Trait Crystals and 500 Gems
  • 1MMembers - Redeem code for 10,000 Red Tickets, 15 Trait Rerolls, 10 Potential Keys, and 10 Frost Keys
  • Freetickets - Redeem code for 5,000 Red Tickets
  • Iboughtbundles!! - Redeem code for 50,000 Red Tickets
  • !Update - Redeem code for 1,250 Red Tickets, 5 Rerolls, and 5 Frost Keys
  • !Gohun - Redeem code for 1,250 Red Tickets and 5 Rerolls
  • UpdateSoon! - Redeem code for 1,000 Gems, 10 Rerolls, and 10 Frost Keys
  • 20MVisits - Redeem code for 1,000 Gems, 5 Rerolls, 3 Frost Keys, 3 Potential Keys, and 1 Basic Luck Potion
  • XMEGACODE - Redeem code for 15 Rerolls, 10 Frost Keys, 10 Potential Keys, and 1 Legends Potion
  • 10MVisits - Redeem code for 1,000 Gems, 5 Potential Keys, and 2 Trait Crystals
  • SorryForFoodBug! - Redeem code for 100 Meat
  • MegaZillas - Redeem code for 750 Gems and 2 Trait Crystals
  • MegaMozKing - Redeem code for 750 Gems and 2 Trait Crystals
  • MegaRlxSage - Redeem code for 750 Gems and 2 Trait Crystals
  • 5mVisits - Redeem code for 500 Gems, 5 Frost Keys, 2 Potential Keys, and 2 Trait Crystals
  • 100kLikes - Redeem code for 1,000 Gems and 10 Trait Crystals
  • sorry4shutdown - Redeem code for 500 Gems, 2 Potential Keys, and 2 Trait Crystals
  • 2MVisits - Redeem code for 500 Gems, 2 Potential Keys, and 2 Trait Crystals
  • 50KLikes - Redeem code for 1,000 Gems
  • 200kMembers - Redeem code for 500 Gems, 2 Potential Keys, and 2 Trait Crystals
  • 1MVisits - Redeem code for 1,000 Gems, 2 Potential Keys, and 5 Trait Crystals
  • Release - Redeem code for 500 Gems and 2 Trait Crystals
  • MozKing - Redeem code for 250 Gems and 1 Trait Crystal
  • SubtoRlxsage - Redeem code for 250 Gems and 1 Trait Crystal
  • SubtoZillas - Redeem code for 250 Gems and 1 Trait Crystal

Some Anime Reborn codes can only be redeemed while playing on private servers or once players have reached a certain level.

All Expired Anime Reborn Codes

  • There are currently no expired Anime Reborn codes.

How to Redeem Codes for Anime Reborn

The process for redeeming Anime Reborn codes should be relatively straightforward for most players, especially those who've redeemed codes in other Roblox games. However, for anybody having trouble, the following step-by-step instructions should prove useful, as too should the video at the top of the page.

  1. Launch Anime Reborn on Roblox .
  2. In the hub world, find the REDEEM CODES! area, which features a glowing blue circle and Luffy sitting on a blue treasure chest.
  3. After interacting with Luffy to open the Codes menu, type or paste one of the working Anime Reborn codes into the "Enter code..." box and then click the green "Redeem" button.

How to Get More Anime Reborn Codes

The best place to get more codes for Anime Reborn is right here, as we're always on the lookout and will add any that we find to the list above. However, players may also want to keep an eye on the developer's socials and the game's official Discord server, as Roblox promo codes are sometimes released in these places as well.

  • Anime Reborn Roblox Group
  • Anime Reborn Discord Server
  • @RealMozKIng Twitter Account
  • @RlxSage Twitter Account
  • @RealZillas Twitter Account

item.title: Skyrim: The 27 Best Husbands In The Game (& How To Marry Them)
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Gamers can settle down in Skyrim by marrying a variety of male characters, each with unique quests and perks to offer as spouses.
  • From blacksmiths to mercenaries, players can choose from a diverse selection of potential husbands throughout the vast world of Skyrim.
  • One must obtain an Amulet of Mara and complete specific quests to unlock the option to marry characters like Octieve San or Vilkas in the game.

If players are looking to finally settle down and find love in The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim , they might be a bit surprised by how many options they have to choose from. So long as they have the Amulet of Mara, pretty much anyone whose trust they have gained will be willing to get married to the Dragonborn and settle down.

While who the player settles down with is a personal choice, there are a few husbands in particular that are recommended picks as the Dragonborn's life-long partner. The best husbands in Skyrim are fun to interact with and boast great combat abilities that make them reliable followers. The marriage system in Skyrim may feel rather threadbare, but players won't mind as long as they get to interact with Skyrim 's male marriage options and interact with the best of the bunch.

Updated on November 29, 2024, by Gerardo Molina: Skyrim is full of possibilities and options for players to explore as they progress through the game. Whether it is the wide range of weapons and armor players can take advantage of, the hundreds of side quests NPCs are ready to give out, or the various potential romantic relationships at their disposal, there's always something new to discover.

Marriage isn't easy, even in video games. To court their potential husbands, players will have to make an effort and do certain things for them to gain their favor, and ultimately, their hearts. While some husbands are a bit more interesting than others, they can all offer wonderful companionship and other perks related to making a home.

How To Get Married In Skyrim

The first step to getting married in Skyrim is to speak with Maramal in Riften . When players first enter the city, they can find him preaching at the Bee and Barb Inn. He can be approached for some additional information about the Temple of Mara. After finishing the conversation, the Dragonborn can get married in the temple.

On top of Maramal's blessing, an Amulet of Mara is required as well. The Amulet of Mara can be purchased from Maramal as well, though it will cost 200 gold. Alternatively, it can be found pretty commonly in random loot or received as a reward at the end of the Book of Love quest from Dinya Balu. Dinya is a quest-giver found at the Temple of Mara in Riften.

27 Octieve San

Requirement: Help Him Pay Off His Debts

  • Location: Usually near the Winking Skeever in Solitude
  • Related Quest: None

There's something about helping out a man down on his luck that will entice any player to try and aid someone. Such is the case with Octieve San, a man who is insecure about his age and drowns out his worries with alcohol. However, things don't stop here he also gambles heavily to the point of racking up a huge debt and putting himself in harm's way.

Thankfully, the altruism of the Dragonborn can help him pay off his debts, allowing him to repay the favor by teaching players how to wield a two-handed weapon properly. If players form a bond with this character while performing this simple act of kindness, then they can also go the extra mile and marry him, which makes for an interesting Skyrim male marriage option .

Curiously enough, while Octieve San is a Breton, his daugther, Evette San, is actually a Nord, which has many implications, including that Evette's mother might be a Nord, that Octieve isn't her biological father, or even that this was a minor oversight by the developers. In any case, it's a fun fact that every Skyrim fan should know.

26 Cosnach

Requirement: Defeat Him In A Brawl

  • Location: The Silver-Blood Inn, Markarth
  • Related Quest: None

Lack of work can send people down a dark path, and such is the case with Cosnach. This character is up for any task that is asked of him, but his job as a porter isn't all that taxing and leaves him with a lot of free time. So, it's no surprise that he can usually be found ingesting a ton of alcohol in the Silver-Blood Inn.

Given his need for gold, he can be goaded into a brawl where the winner earns 100 gold. If players beat him to a pulp, then they will have somehow gained his approval and can ask if he wants to marry them. It's an odd way to tie the knot with one of Skyrim 's male marriage options , but events like these just add to the enduring charm of the game.

Even if players marry Cosnach, they can still give him a drink, which means the option never disappears, regardless of Cosnach's relationship with the Dragonborn.

25 Wilhelm

Requirement: Complete "Lifting The Shroud"

  • Location: The Vilemyr Inn, Ivarstead
  • Related Quest: Lifting the Shroud

Wilhelm is an innkeeper who is pretty engaging to talk to, giving the quest Lifting the Shroud if the player asks for any information. This allows players to explore Shroud Hearth Barrow, which is a pretty unique dungeon in the game.

Completing this quest leads to Wilhelm being unlocked as a potential romance option. He's a pretty normal guy and a fun person to end up with if the player wants a marriage with an innkeeper who knows what's what.

24 Sorex Vinius

Requirement: Deliver Stros M'Kai Rum To Falk Firebeard At The Blue Palace

  • Location: The Winking Skeever, Solitude
  • Related Quest: None

A merchant from Solitude who works at the Winking Skeever, Sorex Vinius has some great stories of his own that players can hear if they interact with him. Marrying him is a pretty simple affair, which may turn some people off the idea of ending up with him.

He will ask the player to deliver Stros M'Kai Rum kegs to Falk Firebeard at Blue Palace. Aside from earning money, the Dragonborn also forms a bond with Sorex Vinius for completing this menial task that can lead to a flourishing marriage.

There are so many different layers to unpack when it comes to Sorex Vinius, as he seems to be a bit of a demanding husband. Funnily enough, if players are married to him and have Heartfire installed, Vinius will seem displeased with every house he's moved into except for Proudspire Manor in Solitude. Talk about having high standards.

23 Gat Gro-Shargakh

Requirement: Liberate Kolskeggr Mine

  • Location: Kolskeggr Mine, The Reach
  • Related Quest: None

Kolskeggr Mine is an area that is overrun by the Forsworn, and players are given a task by Pavo Attius to liberate the mine. The Forsworn are tough opponents but should be easy pickings for the player if they've spent their fair share of time exploring the world and leveling up.

Liberating the mine causes one of the miners, Gat Gro-Shargakh, to become fond of the player. Marrying him allows players to get some profits from his shop, although gamers should always try to empty the cave of any Forsworn whenever they happen to respawn.

If Gat dies at some point during the game, players will receive a Letter of Inheritance given to them by a courier, which comes accompanied by a sum of gold that, while not enough to alleviate the pain in the Dragonborn's heart, might still be put to good use to buy items or anything else.

22 Filnjar

Requirement: Complete "Mine Or Yours"

  • Location: Shor's Stone, The Rift
  • Related Quest: Mine or Yours

It seems that clearing mines of enemies is a great way to attain a hand in marriage. Such is the case with Filnjar, the blacksmith of Shor's Stone, who asks the player to clear Redbelly Mine of frostbite spiders.

Being married to a blacksmith is certainly convenient for players who want to repair their weapons properly without having to invest points in the same. Filnjar is a pretty rugged husband that players should seek out if they are fond of smithing.

21 Sondas Drenim

Requirement: Deliver His Note To Quintus Navale

  • Location: Goldenrock Mine, Darkwater Crossing.
  • Related Quest: None

The idea of doing a Radiant Quest to gain a possible husband may sound like a cheap way to marry someone. However, for what it's worth, players who want to marry a Dunmer can do so by fulfilling a favor for Sondas Dremin.

All they have to do is take his note and deliver it to Quintus Navale. Doing this ensures that players can ask for Sondas' hand in marriage if they wish, though he is far from the best husband in Skyrim .

20 Athis

Requirement: Complete "Glory of the Dead"

  • Location: Jorrvaskr, Whiterun
  • Related Quest: Glory Of The Dead (must join Companions)

It's a rarity to see a Dunmer in a warrior faction like the Companions, but Athis is living proof of the fact that it can happen. He's the only Dunmer in the Companions and is seen engaging in a brawl as soon as the Dragonborn enters Jorrvaskr for the first time.

Athis, like most regular Companion followers, is a great option as a follower for the first 25 levels of the game. The bonus of having him as a spouse is that he provides One-Handed skill training. To marry him, the player needs to finish the Companion quest line fully and become the Harbinger.

19 Belrand

Requirement: Hire For 500 Gold

  • Location: Winking Skeever, Solitude
  • Related Quest: None

Belrand might not be the best-looking spouse in the game, but he makes up for it with his level cap of 40. He'll serve the Dragonborn well for these first 40 levels and is particularly resilient since he uses a combination of spells and sword skills to outwit his enemies.

Belrand also shows a rare degree of personality through his dialogue and commentary, making him great company. To marry him, he needs to be hired for 500 gold as a mercenary. After that, he can be married if players have the Amulet of Mara.

18 Gregor

Requirement: Complete "Thane Of The Pale"

  • Location: Dawnstar
  • Related Quest: Become Thane of the Pale (requires the Hearthfire DLC)

Gregor is another housecarl in the game, and his specialty lies mostly in Heavy Armor and One-Handed combat skills. In order to recruit him and eventually marry him, the Dragonborn should become the Thane of the Pale by running jobs for the Jarl in Dawnstar.

Gregor is a strong one as a spouse. His level cap is at 50, so he'll last the player for ideally half of their game or more, depending on how long it takes them to complete all quests and DLC in Skyrim . He's a great choice, even if he's just a simple housecarl and might lack a bit of personality.

17 Halbarn Iron-Fur

Requirement: Complete "Retaking Thirsk" And "Halbarn's Supplies"

  • Location: Solstheim
  • Related Quests: Retaking Thirsk, followed by Halbarn's Supplies (requires the Dragonborn DLC)

Players can travel to Solstheim to meet Halbarn Iron-Fur, a spouse who won't disappoint. He's extremely strong and knowledgeable about all things blacksmithing. In fact, once all quests related to him are done, he becomes a pretty decent merchant to visit regularly.

Halbarn can also be married, but this requires two entire quests to be completed. The Thirsk must be retaken from the rieklings, after which he requires the Dragonborn to get him 10 stalhrim ingots and 15 ebony ingots. It's all worth it, however, since his level cap is extremely high at 60.

16 Calder

Requirement: Complete "Thane Of Eastmarch"

  • Location: Hjerim, Windhelm
  • Related Quest: Become The Thane Of Eastmarch

Calder is another housecarl in the game, and while housecarls can seem a little lifeless and boring, he has a pretty unique appearance compared to so many other housecarls and human NPCs in the game, which significantly sets him apart.

Calder's level is capped at 50 in true housecarl fashion, so he'll serve as a follower and spouse for just over the first half of the game. He's not the easiest housecarl to get, however, since achieving Thane status involves rubbing elbows with Ulfric (if the Civil War questline hasn't been resolved), buying Hjerim (one of the more expensive homes in Skyrim ), and doing several minor quests around Windhelm. Only the player can decide if he's worth all that effort.

15 Scouts-Many-Marshes

Requirement: Talk To Torbjorn Shatter-Shield About The Argonian Dock Workers

  • Location: Windhelm Docks
  • Related Quest: Argonian Dock Workers

There aren't that many husbands in Skyrim that are Argonians, but even among the few, Scouts-Many-Marshes takes the spot as the best one. He's very much a peace-loving character, and he can be found outside of Windhelm, right by the river.

He's a blacksmith by trade, but he can't be hired as a follower as he's only level 4 and has the blacksmith character type. However, what does make him valuable is the fact that he can offer training in the Light Armor skill, so players who specialize in this category might find him a particularly useful spouse to have. After speaking to him for the first time and helping him with a quest, he can be asked to marry the Dragonborn.

14 Stenvar

Requirement: Hire For 500 Gold

  • Location: Candlehearth Hall, Windhelm
  • Related Quest: None

Looking for a spouse who's not afraid of a fight? Head over to Windhelm's Candlehearth Hall. In the upstairs area at the last table, the Dragonborn will be able to find an old and seasoned mercenary named Stenvar, who can be hired for 500 coins.

He has a decent level cap of 40, so he'll serve the Dragonborn well as a follower and spouse for the first 40 levels of the game. After that, he's best left at home to tend to the shop. The cool part is that he can also become a member of the Blades if invited, and no special quest is needed to marry him.

13 Marcurio

Requirement: Hire For 500 Gold

  • Location: Bee and Barb, Riften
  • Related Quest: None

Not many capable mages want to devote their life to a spouse, but Marcurio is the exception to this rule. He can be found at the Bee and Barb Inn over at Riften, and he'll often be sitting on the first-floor bench, on the left side of the bar counter. He's a mercenary with a hiring price of 500 coins.

Marcurio's level cap is decent as well, and he'll level until 40 with the Dragonborn, making him a fairly strong follower in the first half of the game. He can join the Blades and is well versed in the school of Destruction magic, making him a great damage dealer but squishy when paired with another ranged fighter.

12 Vorstag

Requirement: Hire For 500 Gold

  • Location: Silver-Blood Inn, Markarth
  • Related Quest: None

Vorstag is another mercenary found in Skyrim . His home is the Silver-Blood Inn over in Markarth, and he can be easily recognized by his Nordic armor and flashy war paint. Vorstag has a typical hiring rate of 500 gold coins, similar to all the other mercenaries in the game.

His level will also get capped at 40, which means that, towards higher levels, he's usually best left at home rather than traveled with. Vorstag can be married almost instantly without doing any quests, and like many of the mercenaries, he's also a candidate for joining the Blades. His warrior character type makes him a pretty decent follower for any ranged character, as he specializes in heavy armor.

11 Torvar

Requirement: Complete "Glory Of The Dead"

  • Location: Jorrvaskr, Whiterun
  • Related Quest: Glory Of The Dead (must join the Companions)

Torvar is not the easiest one to deal with. A member of the Companions, he's initially quite nice but becomes a tad jealous as the Dragonborn surpasses him in the ranks of the guild. That being said, he can be married once the Companions' quest Glory of the Dead has been completed.

Torvar is a typical Nord warrior. He's skilled in one-handed, despite his love for two-handed weapons like hammers and axes. Above all, Torvar is a lover of all things alcoholic and will often talk about drinking and getting drunk. But hey, for some Dragonborns, he just might be the one and only.

10 Revyn Sadri

Requirement: Find Viola's Gold Ring

  • Location: Gray Quarter, Windhelm
  • Related Quest: That Was Always There

Head over to Windhelm's Gray Quarter, an area where Dunmer live in poverty and separation from the rest of Windhelm's citizens. Players will find Revyn's shop there and discover that he's a hardworking and principled salesman who dislikes thieves.

In fact, he dislikes thieves so much that he'll give players the task of returning a golden ring to Viola Giordano since he thinks it's a stolen item. If the player stealthily returns the ring, he will be available for marriage and will reward them with some Speech training, but if the player hands Viola the ring face to face, Revyn's shop will face higher taxation, and he will dislike the Dragonborn for it.

9 Roggi Knot-Beard

Requirement: Find His Ancestral Shield

  • Location: Steamscorch Mine or Braidwood Inn, Kynesgrove
  • Related Quest: Fing Roggi Knot-Beard's Ancestral Shield

There's nothing tremendously special about Roggi, but he's a hardworking and honest man. Players can find him at Kynesgrove, working at the Steamscorch Mine and occasionally at Braidwood Inn at nighttime.

Upon meeting him, he'll share a fascinating story about how an ancestor of his founded Kynesgrove but met an unfortunate fate inside a cave and lost his shield. Roggi will then send players off to find this fabled ancestral shield and return it to him, after which he'll be available as a marriage candidate.

8 Ghorbash The Iron Hand

Requirement: Pay His Dowry Or Persuade Him To Leave

  • Location: Dushnik Yal
  • Related Quest: None

Should the player wish to marry an orc, that's possible, too. Travel to the Orc Stronghold of Dushnik Yal near Markarth, and the player will be introduced to Ghorbash there. He's a former exile of his kind, but he misses adventuring out into the wild.

However, since orcs usually cannot leave their people as that would dishonor them, he needs to be persuaded in order to be taken along for the journey. Alternatively, players can brawl with him, and if they win, he'll come along as a follower, after which players can marry him.

item.title: The Open-World Games That Take The Longest To Beat
item.description:
Given their expansive nature, open-world projects tend to be some of the longest games in existence. It's possible to pour hundreds and thousands of hours into a single open-world game without exploring every nook and cranny. They are meant to keep someone engaged for weeks or months, and when done right, they can be absolutely spectacular. Now, longer does not always mean better, but when a project hits the mark, that can certainly be the case.

While there are short open-world games out there, Shadow of the Colossus and Mafia immediately come to mind, most entries in the genre require a significant time investment. That's part of the reason these titles are so popular they reward commitment with content and immersion. These titles are designed to be played for weeks or months on end, taking players on an epic journey across (usually) expansive worlds. Let's take a look at the longest open-world games .

Updated November 30, 2024 by Mark Sammut : The last few weeks did not produce any new open-world games that can be mentioned among the genre's longest, although S.T.A.L.K.E.R 2 could eventually pass that threshold once more votes come in. In the meantime, two older titles have been added to this discussion.

The listed times are taken from HowLongToBeat . The included range covers from the time required to finish a game's main story to a completionist playthrough. The former will be used as the primary metric, while the latter will be used in the case of a tie. Also, only one entry per franchise , although other games will be mentioned as notes. Finally, a game must have at least 4 input times to be considered.

47 Subnautica

3053 Hours

Very few open-world games specifically revolve around underwater exploration, and Subnautica represents this type of experience at its best. Unknown Worlds' 2018 epic is impressively well-rounded, delivering intense encounters, polished survival mechanics, a respectable selection of modes, and a decent enough story that has a strong sense of mystery. Also, the game can get pretty scary at times, even if these moments are not quite consistent enough to warrant a horror label.

Now, depending on the mode chosen, Subnautica can be quite a different experience; however, survival will likely be most people's first experience. As suggested by the name, this mode emphasizes character management by monitoring things like hunger and oxygen. Exploration drives Subnautica , and it is constantly fantastic.

Subnautica: Below Zero lasts about 20 hours. Subnautica 2 has also been announced.

46 The Planet Crafter

3148 Hours

The Planet Crafter is a surprisingly cozy and relaxing survival game. The premise is quite straightforward: Players are tasked with terraforming an alien planet. They land in a mostly deserted world and have to spend their first few hours just meeting their basic needs, which is not easy when oxygen is limited. However, as time passes, they gradually earn the required resources to craft more impressive equipment, machines, and buildings, permitting them to turn this planet into something resembling a home.

While crafting takes center stage, the game emphasizes exploration as well, and the world has quite a range of unique biomes that provide a change of scenery and challenge. More importantly, The Planet Crafter has a genuine endpoint (multiple, actually), so players will be working towards a conclusion rather than just endlessly engaging in a challenge of survival.

45 No Man's Sky

31144 Hours

No Man's Sky had an incredibly rough launch. When it was first released back in 2016, it was met with ire by much of the community. Players cited the lack of content and a failure to deliver on promises made by the developer as the biggest issues, with a general feeling that the game was unfinished. Thankfully, developers listened to the community and stuck with the project, pouring extra work into creating the game that they envisioned from the start.

Nowadays, No Man's Sky is much improved and has seen a couple of DLC releases to help pad out its content even further. In fact, there is not so much to do in the sci-fi exploration and action release that deviating from the main story and doing all the side content will take over 100 hours. There is replayability here too.

44 Dysmantle

3275 Hours

An indie open-world survival game, Dysmantle establishes a gameplay loop that is irresistibly addictive. Set in a post-apocalyptic world featuring zombies, this title's bare-bones sound rather unspectacular, but everything comes together quite seamlessly for one main reason: progression is constant and highly enjoyable.

Players spend the majority of their time in Dysmantle destroying everything around them, and each action grants XP points that can then be used to forge better tools to cause even more devastation. It is a cycle that works brilliantly and ensures that grinding never feels pointless. The world is reasonably large too, even if the isometric camera angle makes the map seem smaller than it is.

43 Grand Theft Auto 5

3284 Hours

Rockstar's latest adventure was so well-received by the community that it continues to see updates and re-releases on consoles. Grand Theft Auto 5 is one of the largest and most ambitious releases in Rockstar's franchise, with a main campaign that spans three separate playable characters.

Although the main story is engrossing enough, there are tons of sidequests and stranger-style missions to complete. It'll take players quite a bit of time and effort to see all there is to see in Los Santos and all the surrounding areas. From there, players can also hop into Grand Theft Auto Online , for even more stories and side-content to tackle.

Obviously, GTA Online is almost endless.

42 Divine Divinity

3270 Hours

Thanks to Divinity: Original Sin 2 and Baldur's Gate 3 , Larian is well-established as one of the best modern RPG developers. While both of those games provide room for exploration and free roam, they are not open-world in the traditional sense but rather feature open areas. However, 2002's Divine Divinity is a more standard representative of the concept, even if it is fairly dated in a lot of ways.

Blending Diablo -style combat with classic PC RPG elements, Divine Divinity does a pretty good job balancing out the two subgenres, delivering a fairly accessible hack and slash system alongside stat-fueled progression and builds. Players are free to explore the world as they see fit, tackling side quests at their leisure. While a bit rough around the edges, this title still has plenty of charm.

41 Space Rangers HD: A War Apart

32173 Hours

Although it certainly shows its age nowadays, Space Rangers 2: Dominators was an impressive sci-fi title when it debuted in 2004. The Russian game blends a surprising number of genres, from trade simulators to shoot 'em ups and RTS. The base game launched with hardly a shortage of content, but 2013's Space Rangers HD: A War Apart adds even more material to it, expanding this title to enormous lengths.

Space Rangers HD takes place in a universe where evil robots called Dominators are trying to take over everything. The player steps into one of the game's various civilizations and must set out to complete faction missions, take a few trips to hyperspace, and make enemies and friends along the way. Not everything about Space Rangers HD: A War Apart has aged gracefully, but the game's open-ended nature is admirable and greatly enhances its replayability, making it one of the longest open-world games ever.

40 Skull And Bones

3340 Hours

Ubisoft created one of the definitive pirate games in Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag , a project that was so successful that a spiritual successor removed from that franchise seemed inevitable. Skull and Bones took a very long time to materialize, and it went through a rather notoriously development cycle; by the time of its 2024 debut, the game had lost most of its momentum following an array of underwhelming reports and previews. While not without positives, Skull and Bones was undeniably a disappointment, particularly its limited gameplay, which felt more restrictive and one-note than the much older Black Flag .

Despite technically containing a main story, this title follows a live-service structure that is meant to encourage indefinite sessions, sort of similar to something like Sea of Thieves . Even if it is not the focus, the campaign is fairly lengthy, and it mostly revolves around targeting specific pirates (who have very little personality). It took Skull and Bones roughly three months to poll just four main story times on HowLongToBeat, which is ridiculous for such a major release.

39 Fade To Silence

3440 Hours

A survival open-world game that came and went in 2019, Fade to Silence is not a highlight of either genre it represents; however, it offers enough positives in each area to warrant an unenthusiastic recommendation to people looking for a bit of both. Dropped into a winter wasteland, players are cast as Ash, a guy who will be spending all of his time exploring, collecting resources, and expanding their base. The game tells a story as well, but it is not too important and does not distract from the gameplay loop.

Fade to Silence can be frustrating, particularly during scenarios that require engaging in combat. Nevertheless, players looking for a meaty survival game might enjoy what they find here, as long as they can deal with a few rough edges.

38 Outward

3398 Hours

Usually, fantasy RPGs cast players as prominent figures, heroes summoned by the stars to change the course of history. Outward opts for a different take as its protagonist starts off as a common adventurer who is merely trying to pay off a debut, and it takes a while for them to become involved in a more important narrative.

While Outward has plenty of issues such as unsatisfying combat, the game nails its open-world. Players are allowed to explore the map to their hearts' content, and the game opens up very quickly. Sure, some routes lead to death, but that is to be expected in this sort of fantasy world.

37 Pokemon Scarlet and Violet

3487 Hours

Following in Pokemon Legends: Arceus ' footsteps, Scarlet and Violet were the first main entry projects in Game Freak's franchise to go down the open-world route, a decision that attracted excitement and trepidation in equal measure. The ninth-generation games got a decisively mixed response, particularly due to pretty bad performance and bugs. Visually, Scarlet and Violet also leave quite a bit to be desired and are fairly rough around the edges.

Still, they are Pokemon games that, for the most part, manage to preserve the traditional loop that has proven popular for the best part of three decades. Sure, the story might be reluctant to provide any significant challenge or try anything all that new, but neither of those things are game killers for Pokemon . The simple excitement of catching and training monsters will seemingly never grow out of fashion.

36 Fallout: New Vegas Ultimate Edition

35145 Hours

When it comes to main stories, Fallout: New Vegas is the longest entry in Bethesda's franchise, although most of the 3D games are similar in length. Obsidian's spin-off is generally hailed as the best post- Fallout 2 entry, particularly due to its implementation of actions and consequences that make the player's decisions seem important.

As with most Bethesda games, New Vegas ' content and longevity go well beyond the base content, at least on PC. These titles are kept alive for years through active modding communities that add a plethora of fresh material, including stuff like quests.

Fallout 4 Game Of The Year Edition has a very similar length to New Vegas , with its story being roughly 34 hours. However, completionist runs are longer at 224 hours. F allout 76 is similar at 35 hours, with 340 hours for everything.

35 Don't Starve Together

35254 Hours

Don't Starve is a popular open-world survival game with a permadeath mechanic; meanwhile, Don't Starve Together frames many of the same ideas around multiplayer, acting both as a sequel and a standalone experience. As both titles have their positives and are worth owning in their own right, players will need to decide which title is better suited to meet their needs. If someone is specifically looking to play with friends, Don't Starve Together is their only choice.

Don't Starve Together is the longer of the two projects, although the time required to complete playthroughs will vary greatly since this is one of those games that plays it fast and loose with its story.

34 Starpoint Gemini 2

3652 Hours

Humanity seemed destined to always gaze at the stars, dreaming of a future when they may fly freely through space's endless expanse. While that reality is still far off, games present a way to experience a slightly similar thrill, all from the comfort of a gaming chair. While not lacking a story, Starpoint Gemini 2 's main appeal is the freedom it grants players, allowing them to jump into their spaceship and explore to their hearts' content.

A true sandbox experience, the game shines in its ability to reward aimlessness, crafting unique scenarios that can only be found if somebody is willing to just go where few have gone before. While not always smooth sailing and occasionally succumbing to repetition, Starpoint Gemini 2 is generally an impressive outing, especially for a relatively small release that is more than a decade old by this point.

33 Days Gone

3765 Hours

Days Gone got lost in the PS4 exclusive shuffle and garnered a polarizing reception at launch. The zombie open-world game centers around Deacon St. John, a biker who goes on a journey to track down his supposedly deceased wife. A surprisingly character-driven piece, Days Gone 's lengthy campaign does have some pacing issues and a slow start, but things do pick up after a couple of hours.

Even if the narrative fails to hit the spot with someone, they can at least look forward to driving their bike across a beautiful world while they try to avoid the undead hordes.

32 Elex 2

3778 Hours

Piranha Bytes specializes in open-world games, an endeavor that goes all the way back to 2001's Gothic . Although typically known for their Eurojank, Piranha's projects are endearing and ambitious for the company's size. Gothic 2 is probably the developer's most famous title, but the Risen and Elex series also have their fans.

Debuting roughly a week after Elden Ring , Elex 2 was utterly overshadowed by FromSoftware's masterpiece. Now that the Lands Between has been fully explored, RPG fans might want to consider visiting Magalan for a fantasy sci-fi adventure. Elex 2 wastes little time in cutting players loose so that they can explore its world, and the game even hands out a jetpack.

Elex clocks in at 27 hours, along with a completionist time of 91 hours.

31 Dragon's Dogma

37102 Hours

2012's Dragon's Dogma is a great action RPG, and Dark Arisen adds roughly 10 hours of awesome content to the base game; however, according to HowLongToBeat, the vanilla version is actually the longer of the two games, at least when it comes to completing the main story. In reality, Dark Arisen might have been a revisit for quite a few players, so they got through the standard quests quicker since they were already familiar with the gameplay.

Capcom drops players in Gransys, a gorgeous open-world densely populated with monsters. While not colossal, the map is expertly crafted to maximize gameplay and combat, the latter of which is fantastic. Dark Arisen introduces Bitterblack Isle, a post-campaign area that significantly ramps up the difficulty and dread. Dragon's Dogma does not have much in the way of memorable characters or writing, and the game's storytelling is unlikely to leave much of a lasting impression. However, almost everything else is well above average, and the simple act of exploration is satisfying.

Dragon's Dogma 2 's main story comes in at 30 hours, while a completionist run requires about 95 hours.

30 Enshrouded

3860 Hours

Similar to a few other very long open-world games , Enshrouded is still in early access, so its overall length will likely fluctuate greatly over the coming months or maybe even years. Beyond that, Keen Games has created a survival RPG that focuses way more on gameplay than storytelling, and it even supports multiplayer and co-op (although solo builds are very viable in Enshrouded ). As such, the goal is to simply exist within this world while gradually expanding the Shroud, so there is not much narrative driving things forward.

Enshrouded is still a long way off completion and does not include much of an endgame at this point. Consequently, the current time is very much a loose estimate that will be very different once the game properly launches.

29 Conan Exiles

38119 Hours

Conan Exiles is one of those titles that someone can easily sink more than a thousand hours into, however, the survival game comes with such a steep learning curve that it can be really difficult to get into. Conan Exiles does have a story that can be somewhat followed, but the majority of the experience revolves around the basic gameplay loop of scavenging, crafting, building, and interacting with other players.

In some ways, this open-world game is similar to Minecraft , at least when it comes to the sandbox. Conan Exiles has amassed quite a dedicated fan base since its launch, and the game still averages thousands of players on Steam.

28 Palworld

3983 Hours

Due to still being in development, Palworld 's actual length is not set in stone, a fact amplified by the project's survival mechanics. While not completely devoid of story beats, the game is designed to encourage players to pursue their own goals without too much direction. As such, players will spend most of their time tracking down different Pals to catch and add to their party or use as workers around their bases. Although incorporating standard survival staples, Palworld's focus gradually shifts to crafting, farming, and combat, especially once players develop a solid routine that ensures they always have their basic needs met.

Early access games are nearly always evolving, with developers using feedback from the community to improve their project's core ideas as they work towards a full release. Consequently, these titles are usually lacking in a few areas, with story missions being common culprits. While these things apply to Palworld , Pocket Pair's game is already in a very good state.
